info.author: thg
info.description:
# ConAST
AST extension (which name comes from `const`) that allows consistency between python versions (Py38+) and utilities like token / bytecode relation constructor.

## Example
```
>>> from conast import parse
>>> parse("2+2")
Module(
    body=[
        Expr(
            value=BinOp(
                left=Constant(
                    value=2,
                    kind=None,
                ),
                op=Add(),
                right=Constant(
                    value=2,
                    kind=None,
                ),
            )
        )
    ],
    type_ignores=[],
)
```
info.name: conast
info.summary: ConAST is an AST extension that allows consistency between python versions (Py38+).

AST extension (which name comes from const) that allows consistency between python versions (Py38+) and utilities like token / bytecode relation constructor.
